profile_positions.description:
Project description: Kafka resource managing system built on top of multi-cluster Managed Kafka which helps to provision, observe and manipulate with topics, connectors, schemas etc in user friendly manner.
Team Size: 2 backed developers, 1 frontend developer
Project role: Key Developer
Responsibilities:
• Project development from the scratch as monolith
• Active participation in initial design with Solution Architect and TechLead
• Constant contribution in solution and architectural design improvement
• Design domain model based on DAG to organise Kafka's elements
• Build development best practices from the scratch like Continuous integration/delivery/deployment, Code review, static code analysis with Sonar, PMD, Checkstyle and FindBug tools
• Conduct demo for stakeholders
• Feature development based on direct feedback from customers
• Constant collaboration with PO for requirement gathering
• Maintain existing infrastructure which used for application runtime: update R53, keep valid certificates, upgrade EKS, fix issues, add security tools like Crowdstrike or Rapid& to EC2

 Achievement:
• Set up observability process which contains metrics gathering, traces gathering and accumulation of it in SignalFX. Implement integration between SignalFX and application to fetch the most important metrics for easier user access
• Design and implement domain entity model based on graph which helps to realise relationship between different elements like topic-connector and simplify this relationship for the user.

Environment:
• MSSQL, PostgreSQL
• Gradle, DBeaver, IntellijIDEA, Jira, Github, Slack, AWS (RDS, ES2, S3, R53, VPC, ELB, KMS), Kubernetes, Helm, Terraform, Jenkins, Gatling, Docker, Liquibase, Grafana, Prometheus, Checkstyle, Findbugs, PMD, Sonar
• Spring (WebFlux, Data, Boot, Cloud Gateway, Security, Cloud Sleuth, Actuator, Test), Reactor, OAuth2, Cucumber, Pact, Lombok, JUnit5(Jupiter), HickariCP

profile_positions.description:
Project description: Data streaming application with configurable source (DB, http) and sink (REST API, DB, S3, DynamoDB) using AWS SDK or Kafka
Team Size: 3 BE dev
Project role: Key Developer
Resp:
• Project development from the scratch as monolith with further splitting on microservices
• Active participation in initial design with Solution Architect and TechLead
• Participation in infrastructure implementation and maintaining with full control of development team (own AWS account, EKS ect)
• Resolving infrastructural problems with scaling, service availability and security
• Build development best practices from the scratch like Continuous integration/delivery/deployment, Code review, static code analysis (Sonar, PMD, Checkstyle, FindBug)
• Conduct demo for stakeholders
• Contribute in BE COP to build common department's standards of Java Software Engineering and present it on special sessions
•  Retirement gathering 

Achievements:
• Improved observability by introducing Prometheus for operational and custom application metrics. Installed Grafana for metrics visualisation, and connect it to internal SSO for internal customer's access.
• Build permission based authorisation model for entities based on Active directory groups and integration with OKTA as identity provider.
• Migrated to Trunk based development for increasing time-to-market
• Build and implemented testing strategy which cover Unit tests, Component tests for each microservice in isolation, Contract test for Http communication between services, E2E (acceptance tests) to check all deployed microservices work correctly before switching B/G deployment

Environment:
• PostgreSQL
• DBeaver, IntellijIDEA, Jira, Github, Slack, AWS (RDS, ES2, S3, R53, ELB, KMS), Kubernetes, Helm, Terraform, Jenkins, Gatling, Docker, Liquibase, Grafana, Prometheus, Gradle
• Spring (WebFlux, Data, Boot, Cloud Gateway, Security, Cloud Sleuth, Actuator, Test), Reactor, OAuth2, Cucumber, Pact, Lombok, JUnit5(Jupiter), HickariCP
